snippet: For some, Labor Day marks the beginning of the choicest time on the city’s beaches, despite the city’s official policy of closing all the beaches to swimming after the holiday.
abstract: Labor Day marks the beginning of best time on New York City's beaches for some, despite the city’s official policy of closing all beaches to swimming after holiday; law is enforced only intermittently, and those determined to stretch out summer often have little trouble doing so.
lead_paragraph: For some, Labor Day marks the beginning of the choicest time on the city’s beaches, despite the city’s official policy of closing all the beaches to swimming after the holiday.

headline.main: On New York City Beaches, Endless Summer
